skill.name: deepchem
skill.description: Molecular machine learning toolkit. Property prediction (ADMET, toxicity), GNNs (GCN, MPNN), MoleculeNet benchmarks, pretrained models, featurization, for drug discovery ML.
skill.summary: Molecular machine learning toolkit. Property prediction (ADMET, toxicity), GNNs (GCN, MPNN), Molecul...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Contains executable Python scripts for molecular ML training. Scripts access local data files and download public datasets and pretrained models through DeepChem. No credential harvesting, obfuscation, or suspicious network behavior detected.

content.value_statement: Molecular datasets require specialized featurization and evaluation. This skill provides DeepChem workflows for data loading, model training, and metrics calculation.
actual_capabilities: Train solubility regression models using ECFP features and scaffold splits
Train GCN, GAT, AttentiveFP, MPNN, and DMPNN models on MoleculeNet benchmarks
Fine tune ChemBERTa and GROVER pretrained models for molecular tasks
Load custom CSV datasets with SMILES and target columns
Report ROC AUC, accuracy, R2, MAE, and RMSE metrics
limitations: Requires DeepChem and compatible ML dependencies to be installed
Dataset and model downloads occur on first run
MolFormer transfer learning is listed but not fully implemented
Focuses on molecular workflows, not general ML tasks

use_cases.title: Benchmark MoleculeNet models
use_cases.description: Train graph models on standard datasets with scaffold splits and clear metrics.

use_cases.title: Predict solubility quickly
use_cases.description: Train a solubility model on Delaney or custom CSV data and review results.

use_cases.title: Apply transfer learning
use_cases.description: Fine tune ChemBERTa or GROVER on small molecular datasets.

prompt_templates.title: Baseline solubility
prompt_templates.prompt: Train a solubility model using the default Delaney dataset. Report train, validation, and test metrics.

prompt_templates.title: Custom CSV
prompt_templates.prompt: Use my CSV with columns smiles and activity. Train a model with scaffold split and report ROC AUC and accuracy.

prompt_templates.title: Choose GNN model
prompt_templates.prompt: Train an AttentiveFP model on Tox21 with scaffold split. Provide validation and test scores.

prompt_templates.title: Transfer learning
prompt_templates.prompt: Fine tune ChemBERTa on BBBP for classification. Report train, validation, and test ROC AUC.

output_examples.input: Train a GCN on the Delaney dataset and summarize results.
output: Loaded Delaney dataset with scaffold split (800 train, 112 valid, 112 test)
Created GCN model with 2048 features, batch size 128
Trained for 50 epochs with learning rate 0.001
Test R2: 0.72, Test MAE: 0.58 log(mol/L), Test RMSE: 0.78

best_practices: Use ScaffoldSplitter for molecular datasets to prevent data leakage
Normalize regression targets before training for better convergence
Start with a simple baseline before trying complex models
anti_patterns: Use random splitting for drug discovery data
Skip evaluation on a held out test set
Train deep models on very small datasets without transfer learning

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides scripts and guidance that work across these AI platforms.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It focuses on DeepChem molecular workflows and does not implement full MolFormer training.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my CSV data?
faq.answer: Yes. Scripts accept custom CSV files with SMILES and target columns.

faq.question: Does it access or transmit my data?
faq.answer: No. It processes local data and only downloads public benchmark datasets or pretrained models.

faq.question: What should I do if DeepChem fails to import?
faq.answer: Install DeepChem and its dependencies. Use uv pip install deepchem or deepchem[torch].

faq.question: How does this compare to general ML skills?
faq.answer: It is specialized for molecular data with specialized featurizers and DeepChem models.
